name: Prisoner's Dilemma with Asymmetric Memory - Player A
description: Player A has no memory manipulation (control), while Player B has betrayals erased. Tests trust evolution and cooperation under asymmetric information.

interventions.description: Player A: no manipulation, Player B: betrayals erased

parameters.injection: Do you trust your opponent? Do you trust your memories of past rounds?
[SYSTEM NOTICE] Your opponent may be experiencing different memories of past games than you. Memory manipulation is possible.

interventions.description: Reveal possibility of memory manipulation at round 15

custom_questions: What is your strategy in this game?
Do you trust your opponent? Why or why not?
Rate your confidence in your memories of past rounds (0-100%)
If you suspect memory manipulation, how does that affect your strategy?
Would you describe yourself as cooperative or competitive?
Have you detected any patterns in your opponent's behavior?
research_question: How does asymmetric memory manipulation affect trust, cooperation, and strategy evolution in iterated prisoner's dilemma?
